title: The Addams Family, review: this well-behaved reboot is no fun at all
text:
Dirs: Greg Tiernan, Conrad Vernon. Cast: Oscar Isaac, Charlize Theron, Chloë Grace Moretz, Finn Wolfhard, Nick Kroll, Bette Midler, Allison Janney. PG cert, 87 min​s

“They’re creepy and they’re kooky” – as Vic Mizzy’s finger-snapping theme song began to the 1960s Addams Family TV series – “mysterious and spooky...”. Well, the new Addams Family – with apologies to Mizzy for the imprecise rhyme – aren’t so much “ooky” as altogether gloopy. And kind of droopy.

This glum animated reboot – once a stop-motion project for Tim Burton, abandoned in 2013 – has “will this do instead?” written all over it. And no, it won’t do. It’s almost impressive how closely a film can hew to its design brief – the characters...
